definition: to accompany/to follow/to occur together with/concomitant
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently

sentences.english: Then the factors which effected spacecrafts long-time adjoint flying were listed and analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 分析影响航天器长期伴随飞行的各种因素。

sentences.english: Hopes and despairs always accompany our life. But never despair of hope.
sentences.chinese: 希望和绝望总是伴随着我们的生活，但永远不要绝望。

sentences.english: Relative study of event-related potentials elicited by calculating and number recognizing;
sentences.chinese: 与另一事件经常伴随发生或者密切相关的事件。

sentences.english: May the joy of the Sping Festival be with you throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 愿新春佳节的喜悦，伴随您度过新的一年。

sentences.english: Small pelagic fish often accompanying sharks or mantas.
sentences.chinese: 经常伴随鲨鱼和蝠鲼游动的远洋小鱼。

sentences.english: Do not bludgeon a problem to death with code.
sentences.chinese: 不要棒击一个问题来伴随代码死亡。

sentences.english: Very uninterest hesitate life and mentally stupefied are following me.
sentences.chinese: 生活很无趣彷徨和迷茫伴随着我。

sentences.english: The son overthrew father, but he would be repenting forever and crime sense followed the son.
sentences.chinese: 儿子推翻父亲，但伴随儿子的将是永远忏悔和罪恶感。

sentences.english: The negative tendencies that accompany any creative project are strong.
sentences.chinese: 伴随任何创造性项目的负面趋势都是强烈的。

sentences.english: China joined into WTO, accompanying with the processes of Duha Round.
sentences.chinese: 中国加入WTO，同时也伴随着多哈回合的历程。

sentences.english: Along with these events there will take place a restructuration of your power structure.
sentences.chinese: 伴随这些事件的发生你们的力量组织也会得到重建。

sentences.english: Of course, for every China bull, there is a bear.
sentences.chinese: 当然，每一个中国牛市，都会有一个熊市伴随。

sentences.english: Maternal pulmonary oedema has been reported with tocolysis and fluid overload.
sentences.chinese: 资料显示孕妇肺水肿并伴随液体超负荷与安胎。

sentences.english: Some types of yoga also involve meditation and chanting.
sentences.chinese: 一些瑜伽也会伴随着冥想和咏唱。

sentences.english: Knife light once appear, coincided with a knife voice.
sentences.chinese: 刀光一旦出现，同时伴随着挥刀的声音。

sentences.english: Compounding the problems of the quake aftermath will likely be the numerous aftershocks that accompany any major earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 震后的问题中可能还有伴随大震而来的无数余震。

definition: to appear/to arise/to emerge/to show up
as the shadow follows the body (idiom)/closely associated with each other/to follow relentlessly
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
